# anypoint_apim (Data Source)

Query all or part of available api manager instances for a given organization and environment.

## Example Usage

```terraform
data "anypoint_apim" "instances" {
  org_id = var.root_org
  env_id = var.env_id

  params {
    query = "flex-backend-app"
    sort = "createdDate"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `env_id` (String) The environment id where the flex gateway instance is defined.
- `org_id` (String) The organization id where the flex gateway instance is defined.

### Optional

- `params` (Block Set, Max: 1) The search parameters. Should only provide one occurrence of the block. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--params))

### Read-Only

- `assets` (List of Object) List assets result of the query (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--assets))
- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.
- `total` (Number) The total number of available results

<a id="nestedblock--params"></a>
### Nested Schema for `params`

Optional:

- `ascending` (Boolean) Whether to sort ascending or descending
- `asset_id` (String) A string that will be checked for an exact match of the asset_id
- `asset_version` (String) A string that will be checked for an exact match of the asset_version
- `autodiscovery_instance_name` (String) A string that will be checked for an exact match of the autodiscovery_instance_name
- `filters` (Set of String) list of filters, which can be "active" and/or "pinned"
- `group_id` (String) A string that will be checked for an exact match of the group_id
- `instance_label` (String) A string that will be checked for an exact match of the instanceLabel
- `limit` (Number) Limit the number of elements in the response.
- `offset` (Number) Skip over a number of elements by specifying an offset value for the query.
- `product_version` (String) A string that will be checked for an exact match of the product_version
- `query` (String) A string that will be checked for a partial or similar matches of the name, description, label and tags
- `sort` (String) The field to sort on
